content.raw: I think the `INSTALL(CODE "execute_process(` approach is not great. I just tested `make uninstall` and it leaves broken symlinks behind.
content.html: I think the INSTALL(CODE "execute_process( approach is not great. I just tested make uninstall and it leaves broken symlinks behind.

content.raw: Nice catch, I'll try a different approach where I first create the symlink in the build dir and then install it like any file, so that it shows up in the install manifest
content.html: Nice catch, I'll try a different approach where I first create the symlink in the build dir and then install it like any file, so that it shows up in the install manifest

content.raw: Here you go: 98d1840
content.html: Here you go: 98d1840

content.raw: thanks that's much better!
content.html: thanks that's much better!

content.raw: I thought using symbolic links would be a good idea here, but it just occurred to me; aren't symbolic links problematic on windows?
content.html: I thought using symbolic links would be a good idea here, but it just occurred to me; aren't symbolic links problematic on windows?

content.raw: Yeah that crossed my mind. I'm not sure what's the recommended approach for Windows, but we could do something different just for it, like copying the file or moving it completely.
content.html: Yeah that crossed my mind. I'm not sure what's the recommended approach for Windows, but we could do something different just for it, like copying the file or moving it completely.

content.raw:
I guess they're trying to make it easier to use them but sometimes they require administrator permissions:

* https://www.wintellect.com/non-admin-users-can-now-create-symlinks-windows-10/
content.html:
I guess they're trying to make it easier to use them but sometimes they require administrator permissions:

content.raw: It [should work](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.13/release/3.13.html#command-line) if we require cmake 3.13, at least on windows. Is this something reasonable to expect? That Windows requires a higher version of cmake?
content.html: It should work if we require cmake 3.13, at least on windows. Is this something reasonable to expect? That Windows requires a higher version of cmake?

content.raw: maybe we could have a special cmake file that gets included only for windows that has `cmake_minimum_required` set to 3.13? because bionic is still only on 3.10.2
content.html: maybe we could have a special cmake file that gets included only for windows that has cmake_minimum_required set to 3.13? because bionic is still only on 3.10.2

content.raw: I guess we can't  use `#ifdef _WIN32` before `cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.5.1 FATAL_ERROR)` right?
content.html: I guess we can't use #ifdef _WIN32 before cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.5.1 FATAL_ERROR) right?

content.raw:
I don't think cmake has `#ifdef`, but maybe:

~~~
if (WIN32)
  add_subdirectory(check_windows_cmake_symlink_support)
endif()
~~~
content.html:
I don't think cmake has #ifdef, but maybe:

if (WIN32)
  add_subdirectory(check_windows_cmake_symlink_support)
endif()

content.raw:
and put a 1-line `CMakeLists.txt` in that folder

~~~
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13 FATAL_ERROR)
~~~
content.html:
and put a 1-line CMakeLists.txt in that folder

cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13 FATAL_ERROR)

content.raw:
But why an extra folder?

This works for me on Linux, but we can't test with Windows yet. My main question is whether `WIN32` is already set before that line.

~~~
diff -r 98d1840f9dca CMakeLists.txt
--- a/CMakeLists.txt    Thu Mar 14 15:40:22 2019 -0700
+++ b/CMakeLists.txt    Thu Mar 14 16:44:53 2019 -0700
@@ -1,4 +1,7 @@
 cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.5.1 FATAL_ERROR)
+if (WIN32)
+  cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13 FATAL_ERROR)
+endif()
 
 #=======================
~~~
content.html:
But why an extra folder?

This works for me on Linux, but we can't test with Windows yet. My main question is whether WIN32 is already set before that line.

diff -r 98d1840f9dca CMakeLists.txt
--- a/CMakeLists.txt    Thu Mar 14 15:40:22 2019 -0700
+++ b/CMakeLists.txt    Thu Mar 14 16:44:53 2019 -0700
@@ -1,4 +1,7 @@
 cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.5.1 FATAL_ERROR)
+if (WIN32)
+  cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13 FATAL_ERROR)
+endif()

 #=======================

content.raw:
the appveyor tests with ign-cmake0 appear to work, so how about the following:

~~~
diff -r aaa2f61124ce src/systems/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/src/systems/CMakeLists.txt        Fri Mar 15 14:07:30 2019 -0700
+++ b/src/systems/CMakeLists.txt        Fri Mar 15 14:16:52 2019 -0700
@@ -66,6 +66,10 @@
   # files, we also install an unversioned symlink into the same versioned folder.
   set(versioned ${CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_PREFIX}${system_target}${CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX})
   set(unversioned ${CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_PREFIX}${PROJECT_NAME_NO_VERSION_LOWER}-${system_name}${CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX})
+  if (WIN32)
+    # create_symlink requires cmake 3.13 on windows
+    cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13 FATAL_ERROR)
+  endif()
   EXECUTE_PROCESS(COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} -E create_symlink ${versioned} ${unversioned})
   INSTALL(FILES ${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/${unversioned} DESTINATION ${IGNITION_GAZEBO_PLUGIN_INSTALL_DIR})
 endfunction()
~~~
content.html:
the appveyor tests with ign-cmake0 appear to work, so how about the following:

diff -r aaa2f61124ce src/systems/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/src/systems/CMakeLists.txt        Fri Mar 15 14:07:30 2019 -0700
+++ b/src/systems/CMakeLists.txt        Fri Mar 15 14:16:52 2019 -0700
@@ -66,6 +66,10 @@
   # files, we also install an unversioned symlink into the same versioned folder.
   set(versioned ${CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_PREFIX}${system_target}${CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX})
   set(unversioned ${CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_PREFIX}${PROJECT_NAME_NO_VERSION_LOWER}-${system_name}${CMAKE_SHARED_LIBRARY_SUFFIX})
+  if (WIN32)
+    # create_symlink requires cmake 3.13 on windows
+    cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13 FATAL_ERROR)
+  endif()
   EXECUTE_PROCESS(COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} -E create_symlink ${versioned} ${unversioned})
   INSTALL(FILES ${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/${unversioned} DESTINATION ${IGNITION_GAZEBO_PLUGIN_INSTALL_DIR})
 endfunction()
